alert.note: Alert for Greensville; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 7:03PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Greensville, southwestern Isle of Wight, Southampton and southeastern Sussex Counties and the City of Franklin through 745 PM EDT... At 703 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sedley, or near Courtland, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain could result in localized ponding of water on roadways. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sedley around 715 PM EDT. Ivor around 745 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Vicksville, Adams Grove, Gray, Berlin, Manry, Worrell, Hilda, Collosse, Dory and Mason. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
